prompt: Either the doctor or the nurses ____ attending the patient.
explanation: Subjects with 'either or', 'neither nor' (Rule 2). The verb agress with the subject. Either the doctor or the nurses are attending the patient.

prompt: Thirty dollars ____ all I have in my wallet.
explanation: Expressions of Time, money, distance, weight (Rule 4). Treated as singular even if they seem plural.

prompt: More than one or more candidates ____ considered for the position.
explanation: Expressions with One (Rule 10). 'One of the', 'One of the only', 'More than one' require a singular verb.

prompt: Everyone ____ excited for the trip.
explanation: Indefinite pronouns like everyone, somebody, nothing (Reule 8). All require a singular verb.

prompt: Macaroni and cheese ____ my comforty food.
explanation: Subjects with 'and' usually takes a plural verb. (Unless 1 entity).

prompt: The pair of sunglasees _____ missing
explanation: Nouns that refer to many items (Rule 5). Require a singular verb.

prompt: The bride and groom ____ dancing together.
explanation: Subjects with 'and' (Rule 1). Usually takes a plural verb. (unless 1 entity).

prompt: Twenty kilos ____ too much to lift for some pepole
explanation: Time, money, distance, weight, etc. (Rule 4). Treated as singular even if they seem plural.

prompt: One third of the cookies ____ burnt.
explanation: Fractions and percentages. The verb agrees with the noun that follows the fraction or percentage.

prompt: Politics ____ public speaking skills.
explanation: Nouns ending 's'. Some nouns look plural but they are not.

prompt: One of the best movies that ____ released last year is still popular.
explanation: Expressions with ONE: One of the / One of the only / More than one (Rule 10). Require a singular verb.

prompt: All of my order ____ delivered on time.
explanation: Quantifiers: All, some, most, a lot, plenty, any, none, more, enough. The verb agrees with the noun that follows.

prompt: The dog, along with its puppies, ____ playing in the yard
explanation: Conjunctions 'as well as', 'together with', 'along with‚Äù (Rule 7). The verb agrees with the main subject, not with the additional phrase.

prompt: Only three quarters of her homework ____ completed.
explanation: Indefinite pronouns like everyone, somebody, nothing (Rule 8). All require a singular verb.

prompt: Something ____ wrong with his laptop
explanation: Indefinite pronouns like everyone, somebody, nothing (Rule 8). All require a singular verb.

prompt: Neither the players nor the coach ____ happy with the results.
explanation: Subjects with either or, either nor (Rule 2). The verb agrees with the subject closer to it.

prompt: Most of the cookies ____ gone
explanation: Quantifiers: All, some, most, a lot, plenty, any, none, more, enough (Rule 9). The verb agrees with the noun that follows.

prompt: The news ____ spreading quickly.
explanation: Nouns ending 's' (Rule 3). Some nouns look plural but they are not.

prompt: The bouquet of roses ____ lovely .
explanation: Nouns that refer to many items (Rule 5). Require a singular verb.

prompt: The guide, as well as the tourists, ____ amazed by the scenery.
explanation: Conjunctions 'as well as', 'together with', 'along with', (Rule 7). The verb agrees with the main subject, not with the additional phrase.
